document.docAuthor: Chagas-Júnior, Amazonas, Knysak, Irene & Guizze, Samuel P. G.
document.masterDocTitle: Revalidation of the subgenus Dactylotergitius Verhoeff, and redescription of Otostigmus (D.) caudatus Brölemann and Otostigmus (D.) cavalcantii Bücherl (Scolopendromorpha: Scolopendridae: Otostigminae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revalidation of the subgenus Dactylotergitius Verhoeff, and redescription of Otostigmus (D.) caudatus Brölemann and Otostigmus (D.) cavalcantii Bücherl (Scolopendromorpha: Scolopendridae: Otostigminae)

bibRefCitation.author: Brolemann
bibRefCitation.refString: Brolemann, H. W. (1902) Myriapodes des Musee de Sao Paulo. Revista do Museu Paulista, 5, 35 - 237.

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 1 – 9. Otostigmus caudatus: Fig. 1 male (MNRJ 15244) from Pinheiros, Fig. 2 female (MNRJ 15240) from Barra de São João, Figs. 3 – 5 males (MNRJ 15180) from Salvador, Figs. 6 - 9 females (MNRJ 15180) from Salvador. 1 cephalic plate, 2 forcipular coxosternum, 3 segment 21 st, ventral, 4 the same, dorsal, 5 the same, lateral, 6 sternites 14 th and 15 th, 7 segment 21 st, ventral, 8 the same, dorsal, 9 the same, lateral. Scale bars Figs. 1 – 9, 1 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 10 – 13. Otostigmus caudatus: male (MNRJ 15180) from Salvador, 10 segment 21 st, lateral, 11 apex of the digitiform prolongation. Figs. 12 - 13. Otostigmus cavalcantii: male (MNRJ 15066) from Santa Cecília. 12 segment 21 st, lateral, 13 apex of the digitiform appendix. Scale bars Figs. 10 - 11, 100 µm. Figs. 12 - 13, 100 µm. Ca, coxopleural appendix.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type specimens:
O. caudatus
holotype male ( MZSP 197 ) from Francisco Morato [Bélem], state of São Paulo; paratypes male and female ( MZSP 199, 198 ) from Paranapiacaba [Alto da Serra] and Itapetininga, state of São Paulo; co-type male ( MNHN DCXXXVII ) from Itapetininga.

Diagnosis: Body color commonly purple, dark blue or light blue (living specimens). Antennae with 18 antennomeres, the first two glabrous, the remaining antennomeres densely covered with short yellow setae Cephalic plate, tergites and sternites smooth; complete paramedian sutures from 6 th to 20 th tergite; sternites with two short anterior sutures from 4 th to 16 th, posterior border of sternite 21 slightly concave. Ultimate tergite of males with digitiform prolongation (“appendix”) and coxopleuron without coxopleural process.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–9.
Otostigmus caudatus
: Fig. 1 male (MNRJ15244) from Pinheiros, Fig. 2 female (MNRJ15240) from Barra de São João, Figs. 3–5 males (MNRJ15180) from Salvador, Figs. 6-9 females (MNRJ15180) from Salvador. 1 cephalic plate, 2 forcipular coxosternum, 3 segment 21st, ventral, 4 the same, dorsal, 5 the same, lateral, 6 sternites 14th and 15th, 7 segment 21st, ventral, 8 the same, dorsal, 9 the same, lateral. Scale bars Figs. 1–9, 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Variation: Legs usually with two tarsal spurs on the first three, four or five legs, sometimes to 11 th or 13 th; one tarsal spur on the fourth, fifth or sixth legs, sometimes on 12 th or 14 th and without spur on the 20 th and 21 st.
